Reviews.Title: No Complaints!
Reviews.Author: Michelle T. "I love to give homemade gifts......
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to replace my Finepix S5100. Mind you, there was nothing wrong with my 5 year old S5100. I just felt the need for something newer. The S5100 was a 4MP camera - the S1000FD is 10MP. I loved my S5100 and it did right by me for years, so I stuck with Fuji. It's still in the family...I gave it to my daughter and she's using it now. (Still ticking after 5 years!) I am not a professional photographer, I just like to take pictures and I don't know a lot about manual settings and such. All I know is, I keep the camera on AUTO and 99% of my pictures come out perfect. The camera does have face finder technology and for the most part, I don't have to fix red eye manually anymore. The large LCD screen is great. Battery usage is normal. (Invest in rechargeables! Save a fortune in batteries!) The zoom is decent, but the real test will be from my seats at Yankee Stadium! I'll update on this one later on. The S1000FD also accepts both SD and XD cards. I am able to use the 1Gb and 2Gb cards from my S5100. I purchased 4Gb SD cards for my Creative Zen and can use them with the S1000FD as well. I don't have issues with close-ups coming out blurry as some have complained about. The camera is a step up from the typical point and shoot cameras and a step (or two) below the expensive SLR's. It's much lighter than the S5100 and smaller. Check out the pics I posted which were taken with the camera. I don't think you'll be disappointed in this camera if you get it.

Reviews.Title: Fuji I Love it
Reviews.Author: Billm-i
Reviews.Content: I love the feel and the size of the camera. The ability to choose the settings most used and save them is nice also. Low light pictures are very good. The quality of the pictures so far is great.Can't beat this ZOOM either.The larger size Lcd is also nice and the fact that you can turn it off and use the viewfinder, or lower the brightness is very much a help at conserving battery life.Speaking of batteries the best part about them is they are available Everywhere.So if your rechargeable AA goes dead you can pop in a store bought AA battery in a pinch.Bottom line very very happy with my purchase.5-30-08After using now for a while here is an update..The camera is light weight has a powerful zoom and flash.Tripod may be needed if zoomed all the way out.I have owned a fuji camera prior to this one and it had manual focus this does not . Poor judgement in my opinion camera would be much better with it.The pictures I have taken for the most part were fantastic but there are ones that I could not get to focus and these were missed opportunities of some great wild life pictures.

Reviews.Title: Pretty amazing features and value
Reviews.Author: Timothy K. Hamilton "Creativity+"
Reviews.Content: It's unbelievable that you can now get a 10 Megapixel camera with 12x optical zoom for just over $200. Some surprising features include:- the ability to do in-camera panoramas. The camera helps you position the 2nd and 3rd shots to match up correctly, but even when I do it hand-held, the result is amazingly seamless.- exposure bracketing with several choices up to -1 to +1 EV.- several white balance modes, and of course you can preview what the WB will look like before you take the shot.WHAT I LIKE:- small, lightweight (smallest of the super-zooms, from what I've read)- ranges from a simple point & shoot to a versatile, customizable camera.- Anything you need to learn about photography before you progress to DSLRs can be learned on this camera (manual exposure, aperture priority, white balance, etc.)- rich colors in Chroma mode, over-saturated but OK.- you can pre-set any of several custom modes in an easily accessible way.- Surprisingly low noise results at ISO 64. Personally I would avoid anything over 100, so it's best in bright light or with flash.- I never have to change a lens or worry about dust on the sensor chip.- Fun and easy to use, with lots of features to play with.- The in-camera 3-photo panorama stitching is impressive.- For about 1/2 the price, I get twice the camera I could 3 years ago. - A great value.- you can review your shot with histogram exposure information, if you like.WHAT I DON'T LIKE:- It has even more shutter lag than my old Fujifilm S5100 from 2005. You generally get the moment AFTER the moment you were trying to capture.- very noisy and high color fringing at higher ISOs.

Reviews.Title: black pictures almost half the time
Reviews.Author: Asteroid
Reviews.Content: Check out the review from 5/25/08 by Challenging Designs and the one from  R. Yomes from 7/10/08.  Something is not right with this camera.  I am putting my comment here to share my experience.I've been experimenting with this camera for the last month and a half. I sometimes don't get focused shots because of the delay and miss out on pictures of my children. I used it at the marina on an overcast day and on AUTO setting and my pictures were far too dark and some were black. Today I placed fresh batteries in it (just in case) and I used it while out golfing at beautiful Kaneohe Bay in the loveliest of conditions...also on AUTO. Half the pictures turned out normal, the other half, all along the ocean in gorgeous conditions, were too dark (black, practically) just as the ones from the overcast day at the marina. My visiting uncle was using his new Panasonic Lumix (I will post it here when I find out which one he has) on AUTO, comparable but about a hundred dollars more expensive, and it had NO trouble on the overcast day at the marina. We even shot several of the same subjects! ALL his exposures were perfect with his Lumix! None of mine were successful. I could not understand what was happening as I held my camera side by side with his to compare. Then I read the review by Challenging Design from 5/25. I have found that my indoor pictures are grainy with the flash and brassy without.My husband and I have been happy with our six-year-old Finepix F601Zoom which, much to our surprise, takes better pictures than this S1000fd. The old F601Z has a delay, another reason, besides more pixels and more zoom, that we attempted to upgrade. My Finepix S1000 will be going back to the store.As of today, I find it interesting that a third person (R. Yomes, 7/10/08) has had black pictures, so that's three of us who are disappointed in this camera. I was wondering what I was doing wrong on "Auto" mode.  I was glad to have had the chance to compare it with another camera so that I could be sure it was not overcast conditions at the marina the first day.  There was no excuse for the failed pictures on the sunny day at the golf course.  After being so pleased with our old Fuji camera, the new one is a huge disappointment. And yes, I returned it to where it was purchased (I had 45 days to try it...I only used it for about a week before it was malfunctioning).  Not quite sure I want the Panasonic, either, as the pictures have great contrast between light and dark without as much depth of color between as I am accustomed to with a Fuji camera.And, like another reviewer, I am annoyed at how easily the lens cap falls off. The "missing" lens cap was my biggest complaint repeatedly my first day using it until I started experiencing the black pictures.I think there's a trend here....three of us have found it takes almost black pictures.

Reviews.Title: Good camera, certainly with flaws
Reviews.Author: Anthony DiBiase
Reviews.Content: The Fujifilm s1000fd is a good camera.  I need to get that established.  The photo quality is excellent for the most part, and it has quite a deal more versatility than a standard Point and Shoot camera.  That said, it has many flaws.  It falls down to a choice--it's a darn cheap camera, so if you're willing to compromise for some things, you'll end up on well.Pros:  The photo quality is pretty darn good.  10 megapixels.  The control interface, though a bit clunky, is efficient and works pretty well.  The lens is very powerful--12x is a long distance, and a similar lens on a dSLR would cost a lot more than the entire camera does here.  SD/SDHC compatibility is nice.  The camera has full manual controls for budding photographers.  Startup time is fast.  The AA battery use is nice for people like me who go backpacking for three weeks and don't have the ability to recharge a Lithium battery pack.Cons: The shutter response time is pathetically slow.  My dad's Canon ultra-compact SD660 is faster to respond than the Fuji, despite the fact that the Fujfilm is newer and better.  The focusing speed is really slow too.  No Image Stabilization--which is a must with a 12x lens!  The Automatic mode bumps the ISO too high, which results in too much noise.  The camera doesn't work too well indoors, either, as the white balance is totally messed up with artificial lighting, despite the use of indoor-lighting specific White Balance settings.Basically, if you're looking for photographic quality without regards to response time and the like, it's a great camera.  And it's really, really cheap compared to the other cameras in it's class.  For the value, it's great.  If you're picky about cameras (like I'm starting to be), the camera is a bit of a annoyance.  But it's a good choice for those not willing to spend $400+ on an entry-level SLR.

Reviews.Title: GREAT
Reviews.Author: K. Gerber
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. It is light weight and takes stunning pictures.I bought it to replace a sony cybershot and I couldn't be more pleased. Great zoom and takes wonderful low light photos too. You can't go wrong with it.

Reviews.Title: FinePix S1000fd
Reviews.Author: G. Coles
Reviews.Content: I just got this camera to replace my old FinePix S3000. The S1000fd is a tremendous camera. I love the large LCD viewing area which is greatI'm still experimenting with all the features but I can say for sure this is well worth the price I paid. Do some homework and shop it for the best price...I've seen it as low as sub $200.The multitude of manual and automatic settings allows you to really enjoy taking photos. This is certainly not the typical point-and-shoot digital camera and it borders on the "semi-pro" level of digital SLR style cameras.It's physical size will surprise you but don't be fooled by it's size...this camera rocks!

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: J. Birecki "JB Dancer"
Reviews.Content: OK, I will admit I was having problems with this camera at first, and thought of buying another camera, as most of my pictures were coming out dark or black until my dad messed with one of the settings, the high speed shooting. Then they came out great! And oddly enough didn't slow down the shutter speed at all. Since then I have gotten nothing short of outstanding!I adore the zoom on this camera because a lot of times I take my camera to the ballpark and get higher seats. Great view for watching, but a lot of times not so great for most point-and-shoots. So the 12x zoom and the 10mp quality on this camera is perfect! If my picture isn't as up close as I would like, I can still crop in some without it looking grainy or pixilated.The colors are great, although sometimes not as true without using an editing program, which is true of most digital cameras. Not the camera's fault, but most times it does stay true to color and lighting.Working in a place that sells cameras I recommend this camera a lot to photographers (or parents) who want something more than your basic point-and-shoot.I posted a couple of my favorite pictures to show how well this camera takes pictures.

Reviews.Title: Best Price Point of any "SLR Like" digital camera
Reviews.Author: C. Cies "Tech Geek"
Reviews.Content: My sister in law bought one of the earlier models of this camera and it has always impressed me with the photos it has taken so, I decided to give a Fuji Fine Pix a long look before I bought my next digital camera.I bought this right before a trip to Hawaii and had very little time to familiarize myself with it. I have to say I am truly thrilled with this camera! It has everything you could want in a point-and-shoot but goes farther with a wide variety of customization settings and features you find on much higher dollar cameras. I know it does not have image stabilization and seen a lot of complaints about shaky pictures when zoomed, etc. but the price reflects this fact. This thing is a bargain! Also, if you over ride the auto settings you can set your film speed to a high enough number that you can stop the shakes with high shutter speeds. I took a lot of pictures on my trip and am just thrilled with them.If you want a camera that takes the picture for you, and you never have to do anything except push the button, spend more money on something else. If you enjoy tinkering with your camera to get the most out of it try the S1000fd. Either way you will never feel bad about the money you spent on it and I think the picture quality will surprise you.

Reviews.Title: Finepix S100fd
Reviews.Author: David T. Rimmer "golf nut"
Reviews.Content: This camera is exactly what I was looking for - a digital camera with good resolution (10mp), strong zoom capability and an eye hole viewer in addition to the LED screen. The controls and menus are very similar to an older Fuji Finepix that I also liked which helps. My step-son, who has a much more expensive SLR camera, was very impressed with the features of this camera.I rate this a very good buy, especially at this price!

Reviews.Title: Great value for the money
Reviews.Author: Brian Cherry "Army X-Ray"
Reviews.Content: The Fujifilm Finepix S1000fd is a great camera for the money. I must clarify by stating that this camera shoots great photos if you know how to use the manual settings. Most of the images I have taken with the auto presets haven't been that great. Using the manual settings allows you the same quality you would expect from higher end cameras. The close-ups are crisp, the color is very clean. The zoom is really good. For those of you who are considering getting into photography seriously or semi-seriously, this is a wonderful starter camera. The fact that you can't change lenses or filters is the only things standing in the way of this camera competing with some of the middle to higher end jobs. If you are looking for a point and shoot, this may not be the best bang for the buck. There are easier to use cameras for less money that will compete with the auto settings on this camera. It is really more for people who can use the manual settings to get very crisp clean images. I would advise getting a tripod. It will make your shots come out a lot clearer.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for Price
Reviews.Author: Roy T. Franklin
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace my Fujifilm S5500, an excellent camera. My only concern about the S1000fd is that I've been getting more noise (grainy) in indoor pics that I did with my previous camera. Meanwhile outdoor photos have been consistently crisp, clear, good color balance, etc. I upgraded primarily for the Sport Mode with a faster shutter speed. I've taken several hundred pics of fast moving toddlers, and I've been very pleased with the results; some noise notwithstanding. All in all, an excellent camera - especially at its price.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera I have ever owned
Reviews.Author: E. Cash
Reviews.Content: This camera is unser friendly if you have some knowledge of cameras. If not, it will probably take an hour of fideting to get it, but once you do its worth it. I have been through my fair share of digital cameras and this one by far our performs them all. The pictures are crisp and clear and the super macro setting is insanely good. It can focus up to 0.8 in!d Its lightweight and may be a little smaller than you may expect but its handy and quick. I love this camera! Ive had it for a week or two now and its still running strong on the batteries it came with.

Reviews.Title: Clear Pictures!
Reviews.Author: Crystal Francis
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. I bought this to replace my Canon SD400. The pictures are VERY clear and crisp. You just have to MAKE SURE it's on the CORRECT setting to get good results. The camera is also a LOT smaller than you think. It can fit into the palm of my hand.

Reviews.Title: Very Disappointed - Do NOT recommend
Reviews.Author: Challenging Designs "Challenging Designs Inc."
Reviews.Content: I was very excited when I first received this camera.  At first the auto settings worked fine.  Unfortunately it didn't last long.  Then I needed to set up user defined settings.  I need the camera for real estate & area photography.  The size and weight were great. I have small hands and it fit well.  Unfortunately when I used the camera to take photos inside a home, without LOTS of windows, it consistently came out noisy.  It is so grainy even Photoshop can't clean it up.  If there are lots of windows and lights, the Natural Light works fantastic.  But that doesn't happen most of the time.I was also told it refreshed quickly so I can take multiple photos (my childrens' band concerts, graduations, etc.) quickly.  They were DEFINATELY wrong.  We had to wait in between and when I used the "continuous" mode (which by the way is a great idea and worked "okay sometimes", it took too long for it to start and it "unfocused" on my subject.  I missed my nephews graduation "shake" with the dean.I applaud the panorama, and with a tripod it was easy and stitched well. However, it maximizes at 3 photos with low resolution and no flash.So I took it outside to do an external virtual tour.  The photos came out VERY brassy and didn't handle the shadows well at all, very noisy (pixelated).  Today we took it to the Marina to try one last time.  It was overcast, but still had okay light.  I used auto, SP2 landscaping, and even manually configured the camera and the photos came out dark and even solid black (underexposed) on many.  You would think the "Auto" mode would take care of outside ambient light, but it was awful.In summary, I love FUJIFILM, the price, weight & grip; the panorama & natural settings are great, some of the times, but they all have too many negatives.I would not recommend this camera at all.  It requires too much manual settings for the amateur and doesn't respond to the settings for the semi-professional.I hope FUJIFILM comes out with an updated version.

Reviews.Title: Very nice little camera, with many features of a much more expensive DSLR.
Reviews.Author: Chris W.
Reviews.Content: For everyday shooting, this is an excellent camera.  It is user-friendly, compact, and takes very clear photos.  The macro mode is superb.  I was producing some spectacular close-ups right out of the box.  There is a slight learning curve if you are not familiar with cameras, but a day of snapping pictures will probably be all you need to get caught up.On the down side, the manual setting are a bit difficult to negotiate.  In very high-light environment, especially where there is a lot of blue sky, it is very difficult to get a good exposure.  Even with lots of manual manipulation, the pictures never seem to come out right.  In general, outdoor pictures come out better than indoor ones.  I am very impressed, however, with the level and quality of color in the pictures.  For things like flowers the pictures come out absolutely brilliant, with exceptional crispness.  If you are leaning towards professional or very advanced photography, I would probably keep saving for a DSLR.  For the rest of us, however, I think this camera is an excellent investment.  Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic camera
Reviews.Author: Kacey "SilvAhyla Photography"
Reviews.Content: This camera makes a GREAT outdoor photography camera. Sure, it can work indoors as well, if you know what you're doing, but the settings are wonderful for the outdoors. Super macro, macro, and zoom all work perfectly.  Lighting is amazing. Flash works well, for the times you use it. It gives me a wide range of options to work with-and I love it. You can choose to use the "auto" mode if you don't know how to get the settings to work for the picture, or you can use it on full manual where you control everything. It also allows those normal settings such as flower, beach, portrait, fireworks, picture stability, etc. The panorama shooting is also a HUGE plus for those scenic views where one screen just doesn't do the justice.Highly recommended.Best camera I've used so far.

Reviews.Title: i usually dont leave review but with this i HAVE to
Reviews.Author: Stefan Murphy "Steve"
Reviews.Content: I usually dont leave reviews, however with this I HAD to. Although I had never owned a Fuji camera before, I bought it based on the reviews from various websites. I have had Sony, Casio and Canon camera's before but it was time to upgrade my Megapixels and also have more user changeable settings.PRO's* Looks nice* Lightweight* Cheap* Supports SDHC* Uses standard AA batteriesCONs* Color is horrible! No matter what mode your in or how you change the settings, the color is always off.* Whitebalance settings do NOT work properly. Sure changing the whitebalance settings changes the colors, but from bad to worse!* Even on the highest quality setting and the best ISO, the image is still grainy and not sharp. Hard to believe it is actually 10 Megapixel.* Extremely slow response (I have kids and need the shutter to work the second I press the button.)I tried playing with the settings for 2 days to get the picture quality I wanted. I had to change settings continuously to get a picture to come out "decent." Since the AUTO setting was poor, it was too cumbersome to take pictures. I had to take the camera back and ended up spending more for a 10 Megapixel Canon Powershot. The Canon is slightly bigger and heavier but well worth it. I figured that it is an investment spending more for a higher quality image, especially if oyu have kids. You cannot put a price on memories. I am completely satisfied with the image quality and functionality of the Canon.

Reviews.Title: A Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Digital Photographer "Used to Like Nikon,s"
Reviews.Content: My Fuji was supposed to arrive 3 days from now, got it this morning nice jobAmazon,was amazed when I took it out of the box, its small, very well made, small, I was so excited to get it going, never read the manual, there is so much on this camera, I was forced to read the manual, after that started shooting with an 2 gig sd card, results were fantastic, gorgeous color and razor sharp photos.I have had several digital cameras, all were reasonably good,,this Fuji is without a doubt a winner, great buy dollar wise and great buy quality wise.A very happy customer!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Not Bad
Reviews.Author: Jellyroll Morton "jazzguy"
Reviews.Content: As a former professional photographer, I have been reluctant to even try out digital cameras. The few I have used were little more than snapshot cameras. The Fujifilm Finepix S1000fd was a pleasant surprise and while it still leaves a lot to be desired when compared to a quality 35mm or especially 2 1/4 format, it performed much better than I expected after reading some of the reviews. Drawbacks include a poor excuse for a lens cap (which I can live with), delayed shutter response in low-light environments and some focus and depth of field issues. Also, the red light that it uses in the auto mode can be very annoying for your subject. But for such an inexpensive camera, the overall picture quality is superb. I don't think you'll find a better digital camera in this price range.

Reviews.Title: Good Intermediate Camera
Reviews.Author: Bill C
Reviews.Content: Good step up from a pocket size compact.  Not a dslr, but plenty of controls when you want to go manual.  Fuji optics are good and the 10 mp resolution gives a sharp picture, even on the long zoom.  That long zoom is the real selling point.  Great to have that much power in a small, easy to handle package.  Option to use xD or SD mem cards is a plus since my gps uses the SD and the other camera, also a Fuji, uses the xD.  Do not like the current version of Finepix Viewer that came with this camera.  Not nearly as  handy to use as the previous version.  All in all, a very good buy for the money.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for a great price
Reviews.Author: Barbara Kaderabek
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera. Just arrived on friday and within about an hour, I was taking pictures, fiddling with the different settings, ect. It is very user friendly and although I did look in the manual to figure out a few things, it is easy to use right out of the box, and easy to figure out from there. I adore the panoramic setting which has already produced some great and fun pictures. Also, using to take up close shots is good as well. Overall, for the price I couldnt have gotten anything better. There are more expensive ones out there with less features! I think this was money well spent.

Reviews.Title: Great purchase
Reviews.Author: Eric
Reviews.Content: "Excellente Item, this camera have lots of modes! really easy to setup some of the basic funtions.. the P mode help a lot for better pix, the N mode for natural light is amazing, everything is perfect on it... it size is awesome!!! great prices, for a good piece!"

Reviews.Title: Disappointing
Reviews.Author: E. Kay "eclectic6"
Reviews.Content: I recently bought a Fujifilm Finepix S1000fd, and I have to say, I'm somewhat disappointed. First of all, the 12x zoom doesn't live up to my expectations. It doesn't have a stabilizer, and the pictures ALWAYS turn out blurry (when zoomed). The night shots didn't turn out as well as I'd hoped, either.On the plus side, however, most of the other settings are nice. I used the "flower" setting to take some pretty amazing, vivid shots. And the flash seems very powerful.However, I don't like it as much as my Nikon Coolpix S500 that I bought recently. The Nikon is more user-friendly, and the pictures actually turn out brighter and more crisp on the Nikon (which was a surprise to me as well). I'd recommend the Fuji for the all the settings and the Macro, but its zoom feature and indoor shots leave something to be desired.

Reviews.Title: AWFUL!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: R. Yomes
Reviews.Content: When we first started using this camera, it was great.  Pictures were nice, video was great, and we were happy with it.  Now after a couple of months and a move to a new area, I would love to drop kick it off a cliff.  The pictures are constantly not coming out.  The photos either are just a black screen, super dark, or way too bright.  When taking photos we must take about 20 of the same thing to get one halfway decent, color close to what it should be.  AVOID this camera!!  Get a cannon or a kodak,  I wish I had.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased with this little camera
Reviews.Author: Lee Rowley
Reviews.Content: I purchased this after giving my daughter my old Canon Powershot and needed a new one to replace it. A very good (and knowledgeable) friend recommended this one to me and so I bought it.There are plenty of reviews here that go into the specs and technical details about this camera but I am going to do a review from a lay-person's perspective.I have been so pleased with this camera! It fits the hand perfectly (good ergonomics) is the perfect weight and the controls are placed for easy access and use. The view screen on the back is nice and big, much bigger than the last camera I had and I find it easier to use the view screen than the view finder.I also really like that it comes with a good solid strap and a lens cap with a good tether. The shoulder strap adjusts to nearly any length and is comfortable around the neck. The lens cap and tether will keep the lens clean and scratch free.The manuals are easy to read and quite thorough. The full user's manual comes on a CD, was easy to install and had all the information you'll need to learn how to use the features of this camera.The only thing that was a little disappointing was the fact that you can't add filters to the lens.Overall I love this camera and would recommend this for beginners and more advanced folks as well. I was reluctant to give up my old Pentax SLR film camera but the images I get with this camera have sold me.

Reviews.Title: I HATE THIS CAMERA...
Reviews.Author: dex
Reviews.Content: this is the worst camera I have ever used!!! Like some of the other people reviewing this camera, I get black pics, for NO reason. the delay is the most rediculous thing ever, it is almost impossible to catch a good shot. the worst part I cant return it, amazon gave me something like 30 days, and I didnt use it too much in that time, now with the holidays I tried to use it alot, and I just went out and got a disposable. my only resort was to take video just so I didnt loose the moment forever, but pictures would have been nice. I just dont understand how ANYONE can give this camera a good review, black or blured pictures with a LONG delay in between???? sounds great.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Guanxiong Mao "Gman"
Reviews.Content: First, I haven't encountered the stubborn dark image problem some people mentioned; although while I was messing with the shutter-priority mode, I did notice that most of the shutter settings produced abnormally under-exposed pics while this didn't occur for the automatic, manual, program, or aperature-priority mode.I think this is just a great camera for the price. Granted, to actually use the megazoom feature, you'd probably need a tripod or really really steady hands, the zoom thing itself is just so neat. All the settings are fun to play with and experiment: learning how to read the exposure histogram, understop the F-stops for aperature settings, the use of bracketting, etc. was a very entertaining use of my winter break time. I haven't found any flaws with the camera; the only quibble has already been noted by many professional reviews: that noise start appearing at ISO 400 (acceptable), but gets way way worse by 800 and utterly unusable by 1600 (like looking at a cheap 80$ B&W; security camera). All the functions and facial algorithm work as you would expect.The camera is built fairly sturdily, and so far, the batteries have lasted a lot longer than I realize (I'm still using the alkalines that came with the package and I've been tinkering with flash, and just about every function of the camera for over 6 hours now over the last few days). Most pictures (Except at really large zooms) come out focused and clear. I'm not an expert so I won't comment on color/saturation but the different setting modes--portrait, night, landscene--seems to work well in emphasizing colors appropriate for these kind of shots. Good technology is so cheap these days: this camera is so much better than the cruddy HP camera I got 5 years ago.Conclusion: solid, reliable product for really cheap price. Wish somebody would figure out a way to attach more securely placed lens caps though.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding camera!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Joe B "Joe B"
Reviews.Content: I bought this S1000 to replace my S700. Why? more megapixels and a few more features. The S700 still works beautifully and I gave it to a friend who wanted a Digital camera but is having some financial difficulty. She's absolutely thrilled with the S700 as I was and I'm even more thrilled with the S1000.Some of the many great features of the S1000 are that it can take a SD card up to 16 gigs! I immediately bought a 16 gig SD card. The means you can do hours of video and the video feature on this camera is excellent for a camera having that feature. The colour, resolution and clarity are superb. The automatic face detection is great and accurate. The zoom is smooth and and gives great pics at a long distance unlike a lot of other cameras out there at a much higher cost. The operation is beyond user friendly. I've had digital cameras for several years and I hav eto say that Fuji is just plain the best out of all them. This actually is the third Fuji I've owned. I'm  gadget freak and just keep upgrading for more features. The quality keeps going up and the price keeps going down. Gotta love it. This camera has a very sturdy, solid feel and looks like a real camera. It sips batteries. I've had it for over a week and have used it a lot just getting accustomed to the multitude of features and I'm still on the Panasonic Alkaline batteries that came with it! I have a fresly charged set of Energizer NIMH batteries ready to go when the original ones wear down. I may have to recharge the NIMH batteries before that happens though. The manual settings are perfectly easy to set up and produce stellar results. Each time I use it and I use it daily, I find more to love about it. As far as the previously mentioned ease of use goes, one might think that it's easy for me since I've been using Digital cameras for several years now and have become seasoned. Well, the Lady I gave my S700 to is not a seasoned Digital camera user. It's her first one. The S700 in some ways has more steps involved than the S1000 to accomplish the same thing. She took to the S700 like a Duck to water with very little coaching from me. The S1000 with more features is even easier to use! I highly recommend the Fuji S1000 for a newbie as well as a seasoned Digital camera user. You'll get professional results with your first click of the shutter. Oh yeah, those of you with Pets! You know how even with the red eye feature on most cameras, your Dog or Cat has the glow in the eyes. With the Fuji S1000, my Puppies eyes are the natural soft, warm Brown she has. Try THAT with another camera! The software is extremely easy to load.With all my enthusiasm, there has to be at least one down side right? yeah, there is but a very minor one. The manual that comes with it is basically just an out line to get you up and running. The detailed manual is on the software. Nobody likes running to the computer to pull up the manual when you wanna do something a little more than point and shoot. Do what I did. Go put and buy a folder, some plastic sleeves, make sure you have paper and enough black ink in your printer and print out the detailed manual. When I say detailed, I really mean detailed. The manual is a whopping 164 pages! You can save paper if your printer can do two sided pages. It's worth it.Just go out and buy the darn thing. You won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: its okay
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "ME :)"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera off of amazon which was the best buy becuase everywhere else was $250, i paid $190something w/ a free memory card/free shipping... also the shipping was super fast.. i ordered it, online it online on a friday said i had to wait until the following Thursday to get it and it was in my mail that Tuesday.. so i was super excited about that!..i ordered the camera becuae it was rated great, i have kids and wanted something fast to take good pitures of the kids and not have it be delayed... but it still has a delay.. so really in my opinion if you want to get fast pics of your kids i'd go w/ a better camera... don't get me wrong i like this camera, better then my last camera, but really.. its not that great... the battories die quickly so i would get rechargable battories (4 AA) save you money in the long run!...

Reviews.Title: Excelente Camara! The Best Camera!
Reviews.Author: Jairo Orozco "MICUPO,COM"
Reviews.Content: Es una camara muy completa y a un precio economico, sin competencia. Se la recomiendo a todos, estoy muy complacido con este producto.Las fotografias son de alta resolucion. Por ser compacta facilita la toma de fotografias con una sola mano. Consume poca bateria. El Flash es potente para espacios internos. Es ideal para quien desea publicar sus fotos en Intenet. Acepta tarjetas SD y XD. Considero que es una de las mejores camaras para el uso cotidiano, facil de manejar, pequeña, ligera y poderosa. No lo piense mucho. Comprela!I think it is a greate camera, have all that you need for take the best picture and a low price. Don not think two time, this is a very good camera, I love it!

Reviews.Title: Great camera for me
Reviews.Author: Brian Morgan
Reviews.Content: This is my first camera, I had been using my parents camera for concerts and such but wanted my own.I went to the chain stores and tried several out and had my mind on another brand. I researched it and it had bad reviews and most people weren't happy.I remembered playing with this Fuji but I couldn't afford it but I liked it alot.I got on Amazon and found it cheaper than the lesser cameras at the chain stores and my dad spotted me some funds to get it.This Fuji camera exceeds all of my expectations. The zoom is clear all the way through the range. It has more features than I will ever master.Bottom line, this is the perfect camera for me.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera!
Reviews.Author: E. Goodwin
Reviews.Content: I am a amature photographer and never had a really good camera to take photos with. Heck, my camera phone had the same megapixel quality as my first digital camera. I did a lot of reading on this camera and a similar Canon. I decided on the Fuji and I do not regret it one bit! I have been having a blast taking pictures of my boys in the pool and my golden retriever leaping for the frisbie. I can't wait to take it camping and get some good photos of nature! This camera has tons of features of which I am still learning, but from what I know so far I don't think that I will miss a good picture again! With 4 AA's the camera is slightly heavy but it takes no time in getting used to it. It feels solid and the large LCD display on the back is a nice feature also. Do your research, but this is a camera I don't think that you will regret!

Reviews.Title: Professional Quality for a Novice
Reviews.Author: Paul N. Hassett
Reviews.Content: For a beginning photographer it's more than what you need. Granted, it's not a SLR camera where you cannot switch lenses of your choosing, but if you want to learn the basics with many options and quality of both pictures and design, this camera is more then acceptable for a novice.

Reviews.Title: S7000 is much better Camera Stay Away .. Low Quality
Reviews.Author: C. Finley "Bubbabooboo"
Reviews.Content: I replaced a Finepix S7000 which had a true resolution of 6.3 megapixels and interpolated resolution of 12 megapixels.  The S7000 is and was a better camera in every way.  Don't be fooled by pixel counts.  The S1000 is poorly made, slow, and produces many more useless images than the S7000.  Quality of construction and a good lens still counts and the S1000 is a loser on both factors.

Reviews.Title: High hopes
Reviews.Author: MysticJaguar
Reviews.Content: I saw the s1500fd at a big box store recently.  I was really impressed by the size and general ergonomics of this camera.  I went looking for a reaonably priced s1000fd to try out.  I was recently on a vacation where I took a Nikon D60 and Canon A720 and was looking for a lighter rig from the D60 for traveling.  I had gotten someone a Fuji A2800 as a gift back in 2001 and was hoping for a much better experience.The feel of the camera in your hand is very good.  The EVF is usable but small.  The 2.7" rear LCD seems to want to be touched when picking up the camera so fingerprint smudges will be common (get a protector).  Fuji's menu systems are not as refined as most of the other players.  The lens design does not permit attachment of a lens hood and it is not threaded to take filters.  The largest concerns are around picture quality.  There is visible grain/noise at most ISO settings under most conditions.  The camera cannot handle strong backlighting and the EVF/LCD in those cases shows an image 2-3 stops brighter than it will actually record.  High contrast scenes in general are not handled well.In comparing images taken with the s1000fd and the A720 of the same subject under identical conditions it is clear that the Fuji sensor is just not picking up detail.  You can see brickwork lines on a building a hundred feet away that are fairly clear on the A720 and just blotchy guesses on the Fuji.  Highlights through a bush that were handled well on the A720 became starbursts on the Fuji.  The Fuji sensor was strong on reds and yellows but very weak on bringing through blues and somewhat week on bring through greens.  Although I ended up returning the model I had in a few days due to SD card read/write errors the largest problem with this camera is the paradox of unfulfilled potential.You have a very nice sized and to hold camera with a decent lens.  There are plenty of settings that an enthusiast would use.  But the design fails to deliver on it's apparent promises by not supporting filters, a lens hood, adequate EVF or clean enough image quality for someone who would be attracted to this kind of platform ('bridge' camera).  Often the red-eye remove cannot locate the eyes.In summary I really like the design of this cameras body, perhaps the best of anything I am aware of.  Canon has been doing very boring designs lately in the bridge/superzoom range.  I suppose someone who has outgrown a P&S; and wants to get into more control, like a teenager, may benefit from this camera.  In past times I would have recommended a top of the line Canon A-series model like A720 or A590.  But it appears Canon have abandoned the A-series to control-less P&S; and am struggling in the new SX series getting things right.  If you are looking for a bridge model then Panasonic FZ28/38? seems to be the stronger contender.

Reviews.Title: best cam for the price
Reviews.Author: J. Chambers
Reviews.Content: i brought this mostly for the 10MP over the 12x zoom cause im in school for computer animation and take thousands of pictures of different type of textures. i recently went and saw the launch of the space shuttle STS-119. i was about 10 miles away, i was able to zoom in all the way onto the launch pad and take picture of the shuttle before it lifted off

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Pictures!
Reviews.Author: Reg 59 "book addict"
Reviews.Content: I currently have a Canon PowerShot A630. At 8.0 megapixels it shoots great ---- or so I thought! I bought the Fujifilm Finepix for my roomate as a Christmas present. Now I wish I had of bought it for myself. 2 megapixels make one hell of a difference! My roomate is a true photo amateur but the pics that she produces with the Finepix are just fabulous. The Finepix is less expensive than the Canon too!If you are looking for a great point and shoot camera for yourself or anyone else, you can't go wrong with this one!

Reviews.Title: Perfect Birthday Gift!!
Reviews.Author: Sue "Sue"
Reviews.Content: Treated myself to this camera for 50th birthday and what a great gift!!  This camera is awesome, easy to use, big enough to hold on to without being bulky, takes great shots - awesome zoom - is very user friendly, and has a wide assortment of settings - beach, flower and night settings are simply  unbelievable!! I couldn't be happier!! If I knew how to post a picture, I would!!! I found a new cool feature everytime I used it. Talked to lots of knowledgeable people and did quite a bit of research on digital cameras before this purchase and am very, very happy I decided on this one. Price was very competitive too!!! Would highly recommend to beginner or seasoned photographer without reservation.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic camera and great value!
Reviews.Author: D. SHAW
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  I made a mistake by purchasing the Kingston 2 meg card.  This camera tries to send too much data to a regular card.  You need to get a high speed SD card to utilize this fantastic camera to it's fullest.I hope this helps you if you purchase this excellent deal!Dave

Reviews.Title: Fuji finepix s1000fd
Reviews.Author: M. Voorhees
Reviews.Content: I waited a long time to enter the digital photography arena, I use a 35mm SLR and never thought a digital could compare.  Well, this one does, the instructions are easy to understand, it operates as advertised, the picture quality is amazing, features are useful and fun to use.  The accompanying FinePix viewer is good, and the user manuel on CD provides extra hints and instructions for use.I would recommend this product to anyone interested in owning a digital camera.

Reviews.Title: Spotty picture quality
Reviews.Author: K. Dockendorf "jkdock"
Reviews.Content: I would not buy againsometimes you get great pictures and the other times you can delete them when you look at the qualityThe lighting is hard even in the manual modethe Auto mode is only good for indoor settingsdo not buy this camera find another that can be one you can rely on for good photos

Reviews.Title: Lots of camera for little money
Reviews.Author: Christoph Knoess
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera that compares well with models twice the price. The combination of 12x zoom, large screen, small case and low weight is hard to beat. The pictures are of great quality and the camera has programs for virtually every type of shot.The only issues I have discovered are:- the lense does not have a thread to attach a standard filter and Fuji does not offer any on its web site- the firmware loaded onto the camera has some minor bugs (e.g., the camera freezes and needs to be turned off and on again when the flash light is shut down before the flash has recharged).These are minor nuisances that still make this camera a steal.

Reviews.Title: most options for the price
Reviews.Author: L. French
Reviews.Content: The camera is a nice small size. Its very easy to use. Plenty of options to have variety but not so many that you need to take a photography class.High quality pictures. When I looked at a picture of my new puppy that I took with this camera you could actually see the individual hairs on the dog. This will be the only excellent quality camera with 10mp and 12x that you will find for the under 220.00 price.I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm FinePix s1000fd
Reviews.Author: C. E. Short
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with this camera.  I was wanting a camera that would do a little more than just point and shoot and this camera does it.  A few features that I'm not so happy are that there is no image stablization with the continous shooting so images can turn out pretty blurry if you're not holding very still.  Using the camera with a tripod would probably solve this problem.  Overall I'm very pleased with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm Finepix S1000fd
Reviews.Author: Lisa Olson
Reviews.Content: Fantastic, easy to use camera....it's just as simple as a point & shoot and takes fantastic pic's. This is our second Fuji in the past 3 years and love the cameras. Fits well in your hand and is small and easy to carry around, yet it takes "BIG" pictures with lots of depth.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Rachel Esterak "Rachel Esterak"
Reviews.Content: This camera is an awesome camera. I have been able to get closer then what it says I can and still stay in focus. I could have paid $100.00 more for the Cannon camera which had more buttons and you have to use both hands to work it but I went with this camera which I can work everything with one hand. I recommend that if your just learning or pro to go with this camera.

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Julia
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!  Does a great job.  Zoom works well and gets very detailed pictures.  There is a lot to learn so plan on taking some time and reading the manual but it is well worth it.  The pictures are quite big so make sure and have space to save them.  I am glad I got the 2 gb memory card.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: J. Jeffries
Reviews.Content: I had an earlier Finepix S-5000 (3Mpx) and took some of my most satisfying photos with that camera.  When the sensor died, I looked for a replacement and settled on the S1000fd based on reviews and features for the value.  So much for value.  My biggest disappointment has been pure and simple image quality.  It looks good on the camera, but when processed in Photoshop for effects or enlargements, the pixel quality is the worse I've seen.  Maybe I just got a bad one, but I'm to the point of looking into returning it if at all possible.

Reviews.Title: The best camera I have ever had !
Reviews.Author: Raj Bapna
Reviews.Content: This camera is simply the best that I have ever had.Since I had first taken pictures from this camera, a little over 3 years ago, I have not been disappointed. 99% of the times, the photographs taken from this camera have been of fine quality and clarity.Prior, to purchasing this camera, I didn't expect such fine quality and clarity in photographs like: close-ups (flowers, birds, etc), near-distance shots (monuments, trees, etc) far-distance shots (landscapes, sunsets, etc) and photographs taken in motion (anonymous).This camera well serves and has every basic photography need and feature: Good megapixels: 10, good zoom: 12x, panorama, scene modes: night, landscape, sunset, flower and 8 others, special modes for: natural light, shutter priority, aperture priority, and videos, along with expandable memory (upto 8 GB). The features offered are excellent for a basic photographer.Since, I am not going to be making a living out of photography, for the next several years of my life, I don't need anything better than this. This camera itself is so good.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, Bulky to Hike with
Reviews.Author: StrayKatJJL
Reviews.Content: I have used this camera for 3 years now. I really like the control options which are quick to access. I haven't used the shutter or aperture settings much, but use the program and natural  setting 95% of the time. The Macros setting produces national geographic results. This is the important part; This is not a point and shoot camera. You must be very aware of the ISO settings, and the display indicating the F Stop and Shutter speed. I have seen a lot of reviews regarding the black results and how the camera is to blame. If you are not aware of the iso setting "thats the f button on the top right" and take a picture on a nice sunny day -with the iso on 800- it will result in a black photo. You can turn around and shoot into a dark creek without changing anything and it will turn out fine. I have learned if you keep it on ISO 64 (slow film for lots of light) and make sure the shutter speed is over 30 the result is a fantastic photo w/o noise. When you go inside change it up for less lighting etc..- now the bad; I have not had very good results with the auto mode. I hope this helps

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY FROM AMAZON!!!
Reviews.Author: M. Eibling
Reviews.Content: I BOUGHT THIS EXACT CAMERA FROM TARGET FOR 179.99 AND BEST BUY ALSO HAS IT FOR 199.99 HERE IT IS 499.99 FOR A NEW ONE. THE PRICE OF A USED ONE IS THE PRICE OF A NEW ELSE WHERE!!!

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: doktorij
Reviews.Content: My pampered S1000fd is slightly over a year old and the lens became stuck in the extended position. Repair is estimated between $75 and $150 plus tax and shipping. I have a ancient Sony that was abused that is still working. Seems this is a more common than you'd think problem with this camera. It wasn't too bad otherwise, although not exceptionally intuitive. Like the ability to use AA batteries versus proprietary battery packs, but will most likely go back to Sony or Canon, they're reliable.

Reviews.Title: Head of the Class.
Reviews.Author: Vichiousfishes
Reviews.Content: I received this as a gift a while back and it is what got me into photography. I recently bought a pro series Olympus but still keep my old Fuji handy. For the photographer who wants to capture those moments with family and friends and also have the ability to set up a stillilfe and play with artzy-fartzy shots too, this camera can do it all.  It's light weight and compact body make it easy to carry around. I have taken this up mountains. It's very comfortable to use in terms of its physical handling and operational accessibility. It can be a little confusing sometimes, as ISO, color, and compression are in one menu and shutter, aperture in another, and white balance, sharpness and other things you might want to adjust in still another. The live screen is excellent but the digital viewfinder is terrible. This can lead to batteries dropping like cats, they die but at a relatively acceptable rate. Luckily it takes AA so if you can find a mercantile way out yonder, you can keep shooting.The zoom is impeccable. I say it can do 70mm-130mm (even if it says different.) but keep in mind that is somewhat tight. You can't get the whole family, Grandma Bertha and the Donelly Twins all in one shot.The focusing is pretty good as long as it's not in full zoom. In the last 4 millimeters it seams to have trouble and tends to leave you with blurry pics; but otherwise it out performs my $600 camera!  You get a shutter of 1/2000 to 8" that can handle what most sane people want to do. The race horse may be difficult to catch. It gets shaky at 6 or so, depending on how shaky you are. But setting it down on a shelf or tripod fixes that right up. There's some shutter lag that can be annoying. The cap has a tendency to come off which may have you wiping off finger prints more than you may want to.  In auto mode you will always get great shots within reason. And when you do want to outsmart the camera you certainly can with the other modes present. I have to mention the macro mode for it is amazing in the price range. It can focus amazingly close and still get you the best pictures you'll ever see; A feat that can be replicated by only the top performing lenses in the world. A $500 macro lens needs about 9 inches to focus correctly. I have pressed thing on to this camera lens and got a shot in crisp focus.  With only standard grievances about this camera I say it is one of the best you can buy. With full auto pocket point-and-shoots cresting $300 these days why not give yourself some control over your pictures. Instead of patrolling the internet looking for tips, get off the couch and shoot!

Reviews.Title: Does everything we need it to do.
Reviews.Author: C. Gifford "CJ"
Reviews.Content: So far, it has proved durable and portable and has many different features, more than we will ever use.  Takes really nice pictures, but the batteries do not seem to last long (requires 4 AA batteries).

Reviews.Title: Colors are horribly over saturated...
Reviews.Author: KD "KD"
Reviews.Content: This camera has quite a lot of neat features and does have a nice "compact feel" to it, however I found the color saturation to be unacceptable and returned it.  I must have tried every possible combination of settings to get decent colors for several days, all to no avail. Indoor pictures always come out with a yellow-orange hue, regardless of lighting and ISO setting. Being 10MP, the picture quality should have been better than it was also.  If you are thinking about this camera, be sure to do a google search for this camera and "sample pictures" first.  Make sure you can live with the over saturation of reds and greens, along with the yellow-orange indoor hue.  I was majorly disappointed with this camera.

Reviews.Title: nice camara!
Reviews.Author: C. westman
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy the versitility of this camara.  I recently took it on a trip to the Caribbean with me and I was able to take some remarkable pictures.  The camara features several color options, 10x zoom, macro (for extreme close-ups: bugs, flowers, etc.), and I also like the slide show option for reviewing my shots.  It is very user friendly, especially for a beginner such as myself.

Reviews.Title: works great
Reviews.Author: Barry Gaffney
Reviews.Content: This is a nice camera for the price, the pictures are real clear.the zoom is great and great for the price. I couldn't find a similar camera for the price

Reviews.Title: my best camera thus far
Reviews.Author: Patricia G. Olguin
Reviews.Content: this is the best camera i have found for my money yet. it works awsome and i would recomend it to anyone. it is not hard to use and has lots of different settings you can use which are really cool. dont listen to the ones that have givin this product a bad review because they obviously dont know how to use a camra and that is why they couldnt get it to work. the camera also has a stablizer so it is hard to get a fuzzy picture.

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT CHOICE
Reviews.Author: Ricardo Velez
Reviews.Content: I used to have a BenQ 10 MP digital cameral, very simple to use, with lots of features even for a newbie like me. but it only had a 3x optical zoom, and after a series of continued pictures, camera would overheat and turned off on it's own, precisely in the moments when picture WAS perfect to shoot. Still have very good pictures from that unit. But the FUJIFILM is a superior camera in all senses. Optical zoom is way much better, the LCD panel on the back is clearer, larger, and has more definition. You can also switch off the LCD to save batteries and use like a conventional  camera. You can program the settings for landscapes and many types of outdoor situations. Has a continious shooting option with manual/automatic shutter, up to 15 consecutive images, perfect for motion photos. Panoramic pictures are amazingly easy to take, and images are incredibly crisp and clear. Even the video option allows you to film with considerably good definition and sound. Very happy about the choice I made with this camera. Would fully recommend to anyone out there.

Reviews.Title: Fuji S1000fd
Reviews.Author: Robert E
Reviews.Content: I have a Lumix TZ3. Great lens! Many great pictures. Lots of fully automatic scene modes BUT no manual control.I bought this Fuji S1000fd at Radio Shack for $179 because of the good price and it has, among many others, a manual setting. I could have saved some money at Amazon but I had it in my hands at Radio Shack and I liked the feel.Consumer Reports rates this near the bottom but I am very pleased with the images it makes.  Yes there is chromatic aberation in the corners and barrel distortion at wide angle, which the pricy Leica lens in the Lumix has been designed to eliminate.  And it does!  Even so,for half the money, this Fuji has a much more powerful flash and much more versatility. I recommend both cameras, but if the pressure is on for a once in a lifetime event, I'm going with the Fuji.Consumer Reports likes the Kodak Z1012.  That's probably why its hard to find a good deal on it. I'm sure it is a good camera and I like my old Kodak C433.  But I'd rather have the Fuji and $50 in my pocket than the Kodak Z1012 and $0.I would like to have a hot shoe or connector for a BIG flash but a camera with that costs at least $100 more.Take a look at the pictures I uploaded.

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: R. Key
Reviews.Content: The camera does everything you could want it to, if you just take the time to read the manual. It has names for things that can be misleading if you don't read the manual.

Reviews.Title: MIXED BAG OF WONDERS
Reviews.Author: gracie's mom "sunnyside44"
Reviews.Content: Like many photographers I get tired of lugging around huge cameras and lenses.  Years ago I had a wonderful finepix s5200 with which I had shot some award winning photographs. I grew as a  photographer and went on to the digital slr and a mighty sore back from the lugging.Enter my purchase of the s1000fd.Now I am not comparing this cam to a dslr but to the quality and low level of noise from a predecessor of the same line of this manufacturer.This model has some great features but the low grade was for the unacceptable amount of grain and the sometimes counter intuitive path to simple functions such as getting out of one mode to another.Still it more than holds its own and when I hit paydirt with this little gem it is a joy. However those great new features may be why the graininess is now an issue.I prefer the N mode and the lack of optical image stabilization. Now the camera is like so many of the long zoom wonders without the great image quality of previous fuji cams that resisted the cry for optical image stabilization.For me that trade off has led to a significant loss of picture quality.  Like the panasonic fz series the image stabilization is a major tradeoff for having to shoot at the absolute lowest speed to compensate for the ugly noise and graininess that makes very few shots taken in shade or natural light usable.Too bad otherwise it is a nice little camera that has much to admire but the bottom line in photography is the end result and when I can only use one out of every fifty shots because of the noise than I am saddened.

Reviews.Title: Fuji Finepix
Reviews.Author: S. Jacobson
Reviews.Content: We are an engineering firm that does forensic investigations.  We just bought two of these cameras, primarily because of the 12X zoom.  The cameras are replacing two Konica Minolta cameras that had a 10X zoom, but have not lasted very long, probably because they are often used under extreme conditions, such as hot attics, in the snow and rain, getting bumped while climbing a ladder, etc.  Our engineers prefer this camera over the older ones because of the larger zoom ratio, bigger screen size and better feel.  Photo quality has been excellent.  Time will tell in regard to durability.

Reviews.Title: Perfect fit
Reviews.Author: Shannon R. Combs
Reviews.Content: Great camera. I am not a photographer but a Graphic designer. I needed a camera better than the mini point and shoot type but not a SLR. This camera is a great bridge between the two levels. It has an auto mode so my technophobe wife can use it, but it also has some advanced controls so I can get the shots I need for my job. One of the features I liked was the macro and super macro so I can shoot objects close up. This camera is a perfect fit for the intermediate non pro. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: Flash Freezing?  Check your memory!
Reviews.Author: Aberdeen Woods
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera as a gift for my daughter, and it works quite well - she likes it a lot.  The only thing that was driving us crazy - when you take a flash picture, the camera would freeze up... and the only way to get it to release and turn off was to pop the battery out.Odd, huh?A search of the web for those symptoms reveals that the problem is with the memory card that I had gotten - I had purchased the 2 GB SD card that was advertised on the page with the camera.[...] is a discussion of the exact issues we were having.  They recommend not using an SD card - but rather a SDHC class 4 card.To test this out - I had her pop the SD card out - and take a picture with flash using the onboard memory.  No freezing whatsoever.I have ordered a 4 GB SDHC class 4 card.....  hoping things will all be well!It is a great camera - clean pictures, lots of great features....  I would recommend it, with the caveat that you need to be aware of the type of card you put in it!

Reviews.Title: Love this product.
Reviews.Author: K. Jahelka
Reviews.Content: I needed an afforable easy to use digital camera that could take action shots (my sons are big lacrosse players). This sounds easy but the last two cameras I purchased had such a shutter delay that th action was gone before the picture was taken...they were great for stills but that is about all. I am not one to spend a lot of time with all the setting and options (which this camera does have) I have set the camera for action shots and have been real happy with the results. My 10 year old daughter loves takeing pictures with it....the zoom allows here to take pictures of her favorite subject...her 2 year old toy poodle. So if your looking for great results with an easy to use product this is it for me...Thank You Fugi

Reviews.Title: Replacement Camera
Reviews.Author: John R. Simmons "Jack"
Reviews.Content: I bought the S1000 to replace an older Fuji camera.  I like the shape of the Fuji because it fits my hand better than the cigarette pkg sized cameras.  This camera had all of the improved features I was looking for and I liked it enough to buy one just like it for my son.

Reviews.Title: This Camera Is awesome!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Amy L. Sheehan
Reviews.Content: I just recived this camera plus a 2GB memory card and the leather case for the camera yesterday. Don't listen to any of the bad reviews on this camera because it is awesome!! It takes the most wonderful pictures with the best clairity you could get with any camera on the lot.I love itDS.

Reviews.Title: From Kodak to Fujifilm
Reviews.Author: Sparkies Mom
Reviews.Content: I used to use a Kodak Easy Share and really enjoyed the camera for many years. However, for my anniversary I decided my husband should upgrade my camera as we both use it a lot.  I liked the look of a SLR so I was drawn to the Fuji.I just got it and I am instantly in love with this camera.  I have been taking pictures of random things just to test it out and it is living up to my expectations.  It takes great micro close ups which I could not do with my previous camera. It allows me to take pictures that retain the ambience of the room without harsh flash. It takes the pictures fast so that my pets do not have time to get away....I highly recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Jessica Culp
Reviews.Content: For the price, this is an astounding buy! Takes great pics, and the zoom is amazing. LOVE IT!!!

Reviews.Title: Great digital camera
Reviews.Author: Wes Jacobs "Mr. Photo Man"
Reviews.Content: I've had my Fujifilm Finepix S1000fd for about three weeks now. Being new to the digital camera, the helpful basic manual C/D and the booklet, make learning how to operate this camera a breeze. So far, it has done everything I've asked of it. My friends and relatives are amazed at how clear the photographs are. Thanks Fuji and thanks Amazon.com for selling it to me at such a competitive price. They had everyone beat by the price and with free shipping what else could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: S1000fd camera
Reviews.Author: dbmac111 "dbmac11"
Reviews.Content: I searched a lot after my almost new digital camera that I never liked, because everything was difficult even closing the battery compartment, died and no parts available :>(.  The Fugifilm Finepix S1000fd is easy to understand, physically friendly and is loaded with features.  I price compared and the value is outstanding too.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera
Reviews.Author: J. Conners
Reviews.Content: I have been playing with the Fuji finepix S1000fd and am very happy. It is very good looking and professional for a non pro. lots of features and very easy to use, I am getting lots of great pictures. I am very happy with this product and what a great price too.

Reviews.Title: Excelent purchase...!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Victor Ibarra
Reviews.Content: It's all I thought it would be. I made a lot of research before making my final decision, and it's definitely the best choice for the price. I've own a couple a Canon of the A series and were very good, but I believe the Fujifilm has better features for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: B. Garza
Reviews.Content: This is a great product for $200. I was considering the Nikon D80, D70, or D40.  Or the Canon Digital Rebel xTi.  Couldn't make up my mind 'cause they're all so expensive.  Time was running out before an important event, so I settled for this inexpensive model, and I've not been sorry.  It takes great images.  The 12x optical zoom is wonderful.  The camera has all the control a photographer from the old days of meters and manual controls could want- aperature preferred, shutter preferred, or totally manual.  Uses both xD and sD storage.  The only complaint I have is that the lens cover doesn't attach securely.

Reviews.Title: Hot and Cold. NOT Recommended
Reviews.Author: The Electron Wizard
Reviews.Content: Well, the price is good but performance is spotty and very problematic. You get less than what you paid for. Aggravation is pretty costly.When it works (half of the time) it's pretty good. Lots of features but not enough for a pro and for "normal folks" the auto mode is poor.For example;1) When using auto mode, the camera renders colors well in bright sunlight but often (not always - no pattern discovered yet) makes the images very yellow under indoor lighting or in mixed sun and shade.2) The camera also has trouble writing to the memory card on about 1 in 100 shots. Opening the battery cover to reset the system works but you have to retake the shot.3) The included software does not play well with XP professional - possibly because this computer only has a slow speed USB port. USB driver would not install and software hangs for periods of fifteen minutes when trying to download images. It also lacks customization features like which exact folder to send the images to. How dumb!4) It's not even possible to easily bypass the crappy software by direct access because the memory card does not show file sizes. Still photos sometimes download fine and sometimes crash. A power cycle of the camera will repair. Avi videos do not download at all. Transfer just hangs until an error msg pops up. Cannot move files either. Must copy, paste, then delete manually.5) Camera does NOT come with an AC adapter jack. You have to buy a horribly overpriced gadget that plugs into the battery compartment instead of your batteries. Then you ALSO need an overpriced AC adapter to connect to that. Sixty bucks later and you could have had a better camera.I would avoid this camera. I never had any of these problems with my four year old Nikon or my 30 year old SLR. They've worked perfectly in all respects. Fuji missed the boat.

Reviews.Title: BK of Delaware
Reviews.Author: W. B. KING "Old Owl"
Reviews.Content: Amazon delivered quickly as always. This is a nice camera with a lot of capabilities and nicely priced. The set-ups for special effects take time to learn. When I discovered Fuji did not have a written hard-copy Owner's Manual available for me to take on field trips, I found it very disappointing. (The Owner's Manual is on a CD.)Consequently I've returned the camera for refund.

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm Finfix S1000fd 10MP Digital Camera 12X Optical Zoom
Reviews.Author: Mel P "mellie"
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I bought a Fujifilm, but not the last! It is really a great little SLR. Great pictures and features for a very low price.To make the flash work, you have to push a button.I LOVE that manual flash. Did you ever shoot inside, where you have to set the camera to turn off the flash ....and then the camera shuts off....and you have to set the camera to turn off the flash again? Not a problem here!The only thing negative (pardon the pun) is the cheep shoulder strap that comes with the camera.Mel

Reviews.Title: Taos to Coos Bay
Reviews.Author: RealNeal
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just used this camera on vacation,it was a new piece of equipment for us, but the on screen prompts made it easy to select the appropriate setting for our photos.  The prompts are brief descriptions of each setting.  We loved to powerful zoom and got some pretty clear wildlife shoots with it.  Its a nice high end amature camera, a LCD lens cover would have been a nice addition, and a auto night setting would be nice too, but overall it is a great little camera that shoots very nice pictures with ease.Fujifilm Finepix S1000fd 10MP Digital Camera with 12x Optical Zoom

Reviews.Title: I love it!
Reviews.Author: M. Hooper
Reviews.Content: my camera arrived sooner than estimated whic is awesome. I bought this camera to take pictures of te animals at the animal shelter.  It works great.  I am still figuring out all the options, but all the pictures I have taken (198)have come out great. The owners manual is very descriptive.  Although a little intimidating for me since I don't know too much about cameras, but I am a fast learner.  I would highly reccomend this to anyone looking for a digital camera.

Reviews.Title: Fuji Finepix S1000fd
Reviews.Author: Lovell K. Henson
Reviews.Content: I got this camera to replace an S700 I had about a year and never did really like.  The S1000FD has more zoom, more megapixels, larger LCD and many more features and is still smaller than the clunky S700.

Reviews.Title: fujifilm finefix s1000fd digital camer
Reviews.Author: Don Huffman "TheCircleDancer"
Reviews.Content: I liked this one so much that when i botched it re my error, I went for another fuji, the S4500.I took the 1000 apart and may come back to this  review if I ever  can fix the thing . But to have a shop fix it costs more than a new one, at least a different model.  Last time I looked these used could be found, amazon and ebay for like $50. I almost got one instead of the 4500.Great little camera.

Reviews.Title: The recommended Camera for anyone
Reviews.Author: Michael L Hensley
Reviews.Content: I have had a S1000fd for last 5 years. I bought it used and this camera has been man handled and borrowed by four teens and numerous adults. It has been world wide. I actually bought this used camera to fix the one that has been abused. My Son fixed the old one with a little ingenuity and now I have two camera that work great. This camera has landscape, beach, night , and portrait settings. It is not impossible to use either. My wife can not use a camera at all but she can point, shoot and take a good picture on automatic with this one. It takes good movie which can be down load by memory card to a computer, and with sound. You need a 4-8Gig SD card for this,  for movies of any longer length of time . 4 gig SD card will get you approximately 800 pictures. I recently was given a new S8200 camera but I still grab one of these for trips or work. I investigate industrial accidents and this camera works great.

Reviews.Title: 10,000 pictures and it still works like I want it to
Reviews.Author: DRYWASHER-BILL
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera over 10 years, and it works well as my work camera.  Whether it's leisure photography, or criminal investigation, this has been one dependable camera.  It is what it is.However, I do not like the digital zoom mechanism at all, because you can never figure out beforehand how the actual zoom pictures will turn out.  But its a camera that doesn't cost 10 bills either, so if something breaks, and can't be repaired (not my experience at all), a replacement would be cheap enough!

Reviews.Title: Picture perfact
Reviews.Author: Darrell F. Grant
Reviews.Content: this is one of the simpilest camaras to run and it takes good pictrues too, the seller was right about it in the discribtion and it was priced just right for what i wanted to spend on a quaility camara

Reviews.Title: Still looking...
Reviews.Author: Kae L. Aschettino "KY Vet Tech"
Reviews.Content: I was curious about the reviews about this camera (after I bought it and after it broke). I have to say that I was in love with this camera. I bought it a few years ago to supplement my Pentax DSLR and never had any problems with it. My absolute favorite parts about it are the zoom in a semi-compact camera and the great low-light capabilities (without flash). I unfortunately didn't keep it in a case and banged it up one too many times and it finally died on me. I debated just buying another one, but felt the need to "upgrade" and bought the Fujifinepix S2980 thinking that I'd get similar (but better MP and Optical zoom) results, but was very disappointed and returned it without really having to second-guess my decision. I'll probably write a brief review on that one, but bottom line here is that I really enjoyed the S100fd and keep hoping that I'll take it out of the box and it'll miraculously work again (like it did once before).

Reviews.Title: Bad on Batteries and flash pictures
Reviews.Author: Good Shepherd Church of the Nazarene
Reviews.Content: Camera goes through lots of batteries and when using flash has a tendency to lock up and then you lose the picture

Reviews.Title: Be careful with the battery door
Reviews.Author: James M.
Reviews.Content: I've had mine for about 5 years and it has been adequate. I have taken a lot of pictures with it, some better than others. There are a lot of features that you can see described in the other reviews.I agree that it is slow and often I miss a good shot, because there is a noticble delay after pressing the shutter button and hearing the click so that if there's any motion in the scene, what you get is not what you see.The worst part is the poorly designed battery door. The latching mechanism is flimsy and under a lot of stress whan closing or closed. The plastic latch mechanism on mine finally gave up the ghost and you have to replace the entire door when it goes, which involves finding a replacement door and dismantling the camera, if the part of the latch on the body doesn't break as well. The part, when you can find it on ebay, costs over $25.00 and I'm sure that if a professional does the job, fixing the camera would cost nearly as much as the camera itself. So now I'm using cable ties to keep the door closed and they frequently interfere with the zoom button. Maybe I'll eventually find a door.

Reviews.Title: The best camera I've ever owned.
Reviews.Author: naser88
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying that I am not a photographer. I took one class in college and the whole aperature, f-stop, etc. went completely over my head. I am for sure a point and shoot type person. I might zoom in or out sometimes but that's pretty much it. This camera takes fantastic pictures with out me having to know much at all. I leave most of my shots in the auto setting or the natural light setting (which turns off the flash.) The first thing I like about this camera is that I did not notice as much shutter lag as I did with other cameras. The moment you're shooting is or is pretty close to the moment you get in the picture. Secondly, the auto focus does very well with close up and zoomed in shots. Other cameras I've owned, once you get too close or get past a certain closeness of the zoom, forget about focusing. Third, I also like what it can do with low light and natural light. I usually only use the flash when taking traditional portrait or group type pictures. Lastly, the panoramic shots came out great (once I figured out how to line them up correctly. The bad ones I got were mostly due to user error.) I can't say how this measures up to other cameras though because I'd never tried a panoramic before this one. Another thing I like about this camera that I didn't realize until recently is that it can use either SD or XD cards which is nice if you already have one or the other from other cameras. I found the user menus easy to use but I might not be the most reliable person for that since I'm so used to them and maybe don't remember what it was like to learn them. It seems like I figured it out pretty quick though.Just for a reference point, other cameras I've used are:-Kodak easy share 6.1 mp: not a bad camera but 6.1mp is low these days and the camera is old-Olympus Stylus 770sw: not a terrible camera and I like the slim design but shutter lag was my biggest complaint with this one. This however is a waterproof digital camera so I use it mostly for that.
